div.p: RB MSS M24, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.
See T. Hart to M, 11 April 1894 (in this edition as 94-04-11b). M's comments quoted in part in J. H. Willis (1960), p. 111. Melbourne, 19 Apr. 1894.

It affords me much pleasure to certify, that Mr T. S. Hart, M.A., is known to me as an accomplished Naturalist, who after extensive University-Studies has acquired also practical Field-Experiences in our Colony, and who has evinced an ardent interest in original and progressive researches. His excellent adress and his high character befit him additionally for any position as a teacher in the applied natural sciences at schools of mines or other practical Institutions.
